segment.source: How to Assign the Proper Credentials for Windows Vista
segment.target: How to Assign the Proper Credentials for Windows Vista

segment.source: How to Assign the Proper Credentials for Windows Vista
segment.target: How to Assign the Proper Credentials for Windows Vista

segment.source: How to Assign the Proper Credentials for Windows Vista
segment.target: How to Assign the Proper Credentials for Windows Vista

segment.source: Use the following procedure to configure the App-V Desktop Client for proper Windows Vista credentials.
segment.target: Use the following procedure to configure the App-V Desktop Client for proper Windows Vista credentials.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: This procedure must be completed on each non-domain joined computer.
segment.target: This procedure must be completed on each non-domain joined computer.

segment.source: Depending on the number of non-domain joined computers in your environment, this could be a very tedious operation.
segment.target: Depending on the number of non-domain joined computers in your environment, this could be a very tedious operation.

segment.source: You can use scripts and the command-line interface for Credential Manager to help administrators automate this process.
segment.target: You can use scripts and the command-line interface for Credential Manager to help administrators automate this process.

segment.source: To assign the proper credentials for App-V clients running Windows Vista
segment.target: To assign the proper credentials for App-V clients running Windows Vista

segment.source: With administrator privileges on the App-V Desktop Client running Windows Vista, open the User Accounts control panel (Classic Control Panel).
segment.target: With administrator privileges on the App-V Desktop Client running Windows Vista, open the User Accounts control panel (Classic Control Panel).

segment.source: Select Manage your network passwords from User Accounts in the left tasks pane.
segment.target: Select Manage your network passwords from User Accounts in the left tasks pane.

segment.source: Select Add on the Stored User Names and Passwords screen.
segment.target: Select Add on the Stored User Names and Passwords screen.

segment.source: On the Stored Credential Properties screen, provide the information for the App-V infrastructure:
segment.target: On the Stored Credential Properties screen, provide the information for the App-V infrastructure:

segment.source: Log on to: External name of the publishing server.
segment.target: Log on to: External name of the publishing server.

segment.source: User name: User name for the external user in the form DomainUsername.
segment.target: User name: User name for the external user in the form DomainUsername.

segment.source: Password: Password for the user account entered in the User name field.
segment.target: Password: Password for the user account entered in the User name field.

segment.source: Leave Credential Type selected, and click OK.
segment.target: Leave Credential Type selected, and click OK.

segment.source: Click Close.
segment.target: Click Close.

segment.source: The credentials are stored in the credential store for proper authentication to the App-V infrastructure.
segment.target: The credentials are stored in the credential store for proper authentication to the App-V infrastructure.
